CatDescriptText: Mr. Rufus Jackson, hotel worker, North Side and Mr. Earl Jones, janitor, Third Ward, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 6, 1962, pg.7 with question: "What goal or goals should the Pittsburgh Negro aim for in 1962?" Mr. Rufus Jackson's answer reads: "Better housing because the Negro, so far, hasn't been able to obtain good housing."  Mr. Earl Jones' answer reads: "I think for more representation in law enforcement in the form of constables, city police, city police inspectors, and other top jobs.  And constables, especially in Third and Fifth Ward there should be more Negro constables."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Rufus Jackson wearing cap with woven band, standing in front of Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Earl Jones wearing light colored fedora with dark band, standing in front of Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
